Article Title: How TikTok-parent company plans to become ‘one of the world's biggest consumers’ of Nvidia’s AI chips
Article Text:
Representative photo

Why this is significant

Despite US implemented measures to limit the sale of high-performance AI chips to Chinese companies, ByteDance , the Chinese tech giant behind TikTok , is reportedly doubling down on its AI ambitions. The company plans to become one of the world's biggest consumers of such hardware and centre to its plan is its reliance on Nvidia chips.Citing a person who has been involved in the plan, a report by The Information says claims that ByteDance plans to spend a staggering $7 billion on Nvidia's cutting-edge AI chips in 2025.“The Chinese owner of TikTok recently told suppliers it planned to spend up to $7 billion to access Nvidia chips outside China in 2025,” the report said.“The effort, led by co-founder Zhang Yiming, would make ByteDance one of the world's biggest consumers of such hardware,” the report added.There have been reports which claim that Chinese companies get access to advanced technology such as Nvidia’s sophisticated AI chips by circumventing restrictions by procuring the chips through channels outside of China.Reports have suggested that the Chinese companies are either creating new entities to bypass restrictions or are training their models outside China.Recent reports, however, claimed that that four major Chinese industry associations have urged domestic firms to exercise caution when purchasing US-made chips, citing concerns about reliability and security. This development could significantly impact American chipmakers such as Nvidia, AMD, and Intel, which have maintained a presence in the Chinese market despite stringent export restrictions.The move came in direct response to the latest round of US export controls on advanced semiconductor technology to China announced earlier this month. The US government has been steadily tightening restrictions on chip shipments to China, aiming to curb the country's technological advancement, particularly in artificial intelligence and military applications.
Article Summary: ByteDance plans to spend $7 billion on Nvidia's cutting-edge AI chips in 2025. The move comes in response to the latest round of US export controls on advanced semiconductor technology to China announced earlier this month. The US government has been steadily tightening restrictions on chip shipments to China, aiming to curb the country's technological advancement.

As advancements in artificial intelligence continue to reshape digital landscapes, a troubling trend has emerged: the creation and dissemination of sexually explicit deepfake images. A recent survey conducted by The Yomiuri Shimbun revealed that Japan ranks third globally in traffic to websites enabling the creation of such content. Over the course of a year, these platforms received over 18 million visits from Japan alone, trailing only the United States and India. The growing prevalence of explicit deepfake content has raised significant ethical and legal concerns, prompting calls for urgent action.The survey, conducted in collaboration with digital analytics firm Similarweb Ltd., analyzed traffic data from December 2023 to November 2024. The findings identified 41 websites that allow users to produce sexually explicit deepfake images by uploading photographs of individuals. These platforms, many of which launched in 2024, saw a surge in popularity alongside increased accessibility to generative AI technology.The global distribution of traffic to these sites highlights the scale of the issue:In Japan, an estimated 410,000 users accessed these sites monthly, with approximately 80% doing so via smartphones. Instructions for creating deepfake content were predominantly available in English, Russian, and Japanese, underscoring the international reach and accessibility of such platforms.The proliferation of deepfake technology has coincided with a sharp increase in explicit content creation. According to U.S.-based cybersecurity firm Security Hero, 95,820 deepfake videos were detected online in 2023, a figure five and a half times higher than in 2019. Alarmingly, 98% of these videos were of a sexually explicit nature.The creation and sharing of such content have profound implications, particularly for victims whose images are manipulated without consent. Social media platforms often serve as the primary channels for distributing deepfake content, compounding the harm by amplifying its reach.While deepfake technology is not inherently malicious, its misuse has sparked widespread concern. Experts argue that existing laws in many countries are ill-equipped to address the complexities of AI-generated content. In Japan, for instance, there are no specific legal provisions targeting the creation or distribution of deepfake pornography.Ichiro Sato, a professor at the National Institute of Informatics, has emphasised the urgent need for legislative reform. “Laws tailored to address deepfake technology must be introduced to protect individuals from exploitation,” Sato stated. He also highlighted the importance of promoting information literacy to equip people with the knowledge to recognize and combat deepfake content.Several nations have already taken steps to address the challenges posed by deepfake technology. In the United States, multiple states have enacted laws criminalizing the creation and distribution of non-consensual deepfake pornography . The European Union has also proposed regulations to hold AI developers accountable for the ethical use of their technologies.Japan’s position as a major user of deepfake platforms underscores the necessity for similar measures. Beyond legislation, public awareness campaigns and educational initiatives are critical to fostering a culture of digital responsibility.
Article Summary: Japan ranks third globally in traffic to websites enabling the creation of such content. Over the course of a year, these platforms received over 18 million visits from Japan alone. The growing prevalence of explicit deepfake content has raised significant ethical and legal concerns.

Article Title: NPCI issues an advisory about 'online scams' that Indians are losing crores to
Article Text:
What NPCI advisory says

What is digital arrest scam



How to identify a digital arrest scam

Unexpected Contact from ‘Officials’: Be cautious if someone claims to be from government agencies like the police, CBI, income tax officers, or customs agents, contacts you. Be cautious especially if they claim urgent legal action is being initiated or warranted. They might allege that you or one of your family members is involved in a serious crime like money laundering, tax evasion, or drug trafficking.

Fear-based language and urgency: Scammers may request video calls, disguising themselves in police uniforms, using government logos, or creating official-sounding background noise to appear legitimate. They often threaten arrest or immediate legal action, demanding a quick response and using legal terms to sound convincing. In some cases, they create a police station-like set up to further convince victims of their credibility.

Request for sensitive information or payment: Scammers may ask for personal information or demand large sums of money, promising that this will clear up your involvement in the alleged crime. Terms like “clearing your name”, “assisting with the investigation”, or “refundable security deposit/escrow account” might be used by them to persuade you into transferring money to specified bank accounts or UPI IDs.

Tips to stay safe

Pause and Verify: If you receive unexpected calls or messages about legal issues, take a moment to verify. Stay calm, as scammers rely on fear and urgency. Real government and law enforcement agencies will never ask for money or investigate cases through phone or video calls. Article Title: Airbnb blocked 74,000 bookings worldwide on New Year eve in 2023, and says will follow same measures in 2024 as well
Article Text:
How Airbnb checks ‘party’ booking

Planning a New Year's Eve party at an Airbnb? Think again. The company is deploying anti-party technology globally to prevent "unauthorized and disruptive" gatherings during the holiday season. This technology uses machine learning to identify and block risky bookings, focusing on factors like trip length, booking timing, and distance from the guest's location. While implemented worldwide, the technology will specifically target the US, UK, Australia, Canada, France, Puerto Rico, Spain and New Zealand. Last New Year's Eve, Airbnb blocked 74,000 such bookings.High-risk bookings will be blocked or redirected to alternative accommodations. Short holiday getaways (one to three nights) in entire homes will also be restricted, and guests booking entire homes will be required to agree to a "mandatory anti-party attestation." "If a booking is identified as higher risk, the guest will either be blocked from booking, or redirected to alternative accommodations on the platform," the company said.Guests will also be required to accept mandatory anti-party attestation. "Guests who can make reservations will need to confirm that they understand that disruptive and unauthorized parties are not allowed on Airbnb, and they face suspension or removal from the platform if they violate this policy," said the company.Airbnb also has a 'Neighborhood Support Line' for local communities to report urgent issues, like a party in progress, at a home they believe is listed on Airbnb.Airbnb's efforts to curb disruptive parties started in 2019 with a ban on "party houses," followed by stricter measures in 2020 due to the pandemic. In 2022, the company permanently banned large parties worldwide following several violent incidents at Airbnb rentals, including a shooting in Pittsburgh that resulted in two deaths and eight injuries.
Article Summary: Airbnb is deploying anti-party technology globally to prevent "unauthorized and disruptive" gatherings during the holiday season. The technology uses machine learning to identify and block risky bookings, focusing on factors like trip length, booking timing, and distance from the guest's location.

Article Title: Hacked Chrome extensions put Facebook Ads users at risk; these are the versions impacted
Article Text:
Which Google Chrome versions are impacted

Hackers have injected harmful code into several Google Chrome extensions, targeting users of Facebook Ads. Cybersecurity firm Cyberhaven revealed that the malicious extensions were designed to steal sensitive information like access tokens, user IDs, account details, and cookies. This puts Facebook Ads users at serious risk of data theft and account hacking.In a blog post, Cyberhaven reported that its own Chrome extension was hacked on December 24 in an attack aimed at social media advertising and AI platform logins. Other extensions, such as ParrotTalks, Uvoice, and VPNCity, were also impacted starting in mid-December, according to Jaime Blasco from Nudge Security, as reported by Reuters.The breach was first detected on December 25, and researchers quickly removed the harmful version of the extension within an hour.“On December 24, a phishing attack compromised a Cyberhaven employee's credentials to the Google Chrome Web Store. The attacker used these credentials to publish a malicious version of our Chrome extension (version 24.10.4). Our security team detected this compromise at 11:54 PM UTC on December 25 and removed the malicious package within 60 minutes,” Cyberhaven said in a blog post.According to Cyberhaven, the incident was brief and limited in scope. Only version 24.10.4 of the Cyberhaven Chrome extension was affected, and the malicious code was active from 1:32 AM UTC on December 25 to 2:50 AM UTC on December 26. Chrome browsers that auto-updated the extension during this time were impacted.The company clarified, "Our investigation found that no other Cyberhaven systems were compromised." For affected browsers, the malicious code may have stolen cookies and login sessions from certain websites. Initial findings suggest the attacker specifically targeted logins to social media advertising and AI platforms.
Article Summary: Hackers have injected harmful code into several Google Chrome extensions, targeting users of Facebook Ads. Cybersecurity firm Cyberhaven revealed that the malicious extensions were designed to steal sensitive information like access tokens, user IDs, account details, and cookies. Article Title: Chinese hackers hit two of the largest US telecom giants, what the companies have to say

Two of the largest telecom companies in the US, AT&T and Verizon , have acknowledged they were targeted by the Chinese-linked Salt Typhoon cyberespionage operation, but assured customers that their US networks are now secure after working with law enforcement and government officials.According to a report by news agency Reuters, both the companies said that the hackers gained access to their systems. Based on our current investigation of this attack, the People's Republic of China targeted a small number of individuals of foreign intelligence interest,” an AT&T spokesperson was quoted as saying.It said that only a few cases of compromised information were identified and the company is monitoring its networks to protect customers data.Meanwhile, erizon said that it has not detected any such activity in its network.“We have not detected threat actor activity in Verizon's network for some time, and after considerable work addressing this incident, we can report that Verizon has contained the activities associated with this particular incident,” Verizon's chief legal officer said.This news comes after US officials revealed that Salt Typhoon hackers had compromised at least nine telecommunications companies, gaining “broad and full access” to networks, enabling them to track millions of individuals and intercept phone calls. Article Title: What is behind Apple’s ‘allergy’ to the world’s biggest and most successful AI chip company Nvidia
Article Text:
What is Apple's 'allergy' with Nvidia

Apple looking to partner with Broadcom to design AI chip

While Apple has joined the ranks of tech giants integrating AI features into its devices, the company is quietly pursuing a strategy to reduce its reliance on Nvidia, the dominant provider of GPUs crucial for AI development, a report has said. Despite currently depending on the chipmaker's technology, like many others in the industry, Apple is taking steps to lessen its dependence on Nvidia because of an 'allergy'.According to a report by The Information, unlike other tech giants who are buying up Nvidia's GPUs in bulk, Apple is primarily renting access to them through cloud providers.“Instead of buying boatloads of Nvidia chips as its tech peers do, the iPhone maker mostly rents access to them from cloud providers like Amazon and Microsoft. In some cases-for example, to train its biggest models-Apple has rented Al chips designed in-house by Google rather than Nvidia,” the report said.Apple’s move to break free from Nvidia appears to be rooted in both financial considerations and Apple's desire for technological autonomy in its products, the report said.“Apple's Nvidia allergy appears to stem partly from its frugality and a desire to own and control the key technological ingredients for its products to avoid giving others leverage over its operations,” it added.“But leaders within Apple have also quietly nursed grudges against Nvidia for nearly two decades, stemming from business disputes that originated during the era when Steve Jobs was Apple's CEO,” the report noted, citing 10 former Apple and Nvidia employees with direct knowledge of the relationship.The report says that the most significant development in Apple's quest for independence is a partnership with Broadcom to develop its own AI server chip .“And in its boldest move yet to avoid relying on Nvidia, Apple is working with Broadcom to design an Al server chip expected to be ready for mass production by 2026,” it added.The chip's networking technology is said to be crucial for Al processing. If Apple succeeds with the Al chip, internally code-named Baltra, it would mark a significant milestone for the company's silicon team, the publication said.
Article Summary: Apple looking to partner with Broadcom to design AI chip, report says. Apple is taking steps to lessen its dependence on Nvidia because of an 'allergy' Apple is primarily renting access to Nvidia's GPUs through cloud providers. Apple's move to break free from Nvidia appears to be rooted in both financial considerations and Apple's desire for technological autonomy.

Article Title: iPhone’s Photos app on iOS 18 allegedly sharing data with Apple, here’s what we know
Article Text: iPhone’s Photos app is sharing users' photo data with Apple without explicit consent, according to developer Jeff Johnson . The feature, called "Enhanced Visual Search," enables landmark identification but requires data sharing with Apple's servers.Users checking their iPhone 15 Pro and other iOS devices are finding the setting automatically enabled in their Photos app settings. The feature, which can be accessed through iOS Settings or Mac's Photos app settings, allows users to identify landmarks in their photos and search for images using landmark names.While the feature appears to be an extension of the Visual Look Up capability introduced in iOS 15, it differs significantly in its data-sharing requirements. Unlike Visual Look Up, which operates entirely on-device, Enhanced Visual Search sends encrypted "vector embeddings" - numerical representations of image characteristics - to Apple's servers for landmark matching.According to Apple's machine learning research blog, the process begins with an on-device analysis to detect "regions of interest" that might contain landmarks. When detected, these regions are converted into vector embeddings before being encrypted and sent to Apple for comparison against their global landmark database.Despite Apple's implementation of privacy measures, including data encryption and condensed image formatting, the default activation of this data-sharing feature has sparked concerns. The company's approach contrasts with its handling of other data collection features, such as Siri interactions and analytics, which typically require explicit user opt-in.Apple has not yet responded to requests for comment about these privacy concerns. Users can manually disable the feature by navigating to the Photos settings in their iOS Settings app or Mac Photos app settings menu.
Article Summary: iPhone's Photos app is automatically sharing users' photo data with Apple. The feature, called "Enhanced Visual Search," enables landmark identification but requires data sharing with Apple's servers. Users can manually disable the feature by navigating to the Photos settings in their iOS Settings app or Mac Photos app settings menu.

Article Title: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu tells why he’s not worried about Indian talent migration, “Rising talent migration from India is not a symptom of hopelessness, it is…"
Article Text: Following his recent call for Indians to build technological capabilities at home rather than chase validation abroad, Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu has offered an optimistic take on the country's increasing talent migration, arguing that it actually signals economic transformation rather than decline.In a detailed social media post, Vembu explained that peak talent migration typically coincides with periods of rapid national development, citing historical patterns from other Asian economies. "Talent migration from Korea and Taiwan peaked in the 1970s and 80s, while Chinese migration peaked about a decade ago – all during periods of transformative growth in these nations," Vembu noted. He pointed to Silicon Valley 's shifting demographics, where Indian migrants now outnumber those from China, Hong Kong, and Taiwan, as evidence of this pattern.Vembu explained that migration patterns follow a predictable curve: very low during extreme underdevelopment, peaking during rapid growth, and declining again as nations achieve prosperity. He attributed this phenomenon to rising aspirational levels that precede and drive economic development."Our aspirations necessarily race ahead of reality, and it is precisely during the period of rapid growth that we have the most restless people," Vembu explained, connecting this restlessness to the current atmosphere in India's urban tech centers.While advocating for domestic talent retention to build India's technological capabilities, Vembu predicted that Indians might continue to underestimate their nation's progress even as late as 2035, when per capita GDP could exceed $10,000. He drew parallels to Japan's and Korea's historical experiences, where citizens remained skeptical of their nations' advancement even after achieving parity with Western economies.The CEO's comments came amid broader discussions about Indian immigration and talent retention . Earlier, Vembu had questioned whether pursuing GDP rankings and technological leadership through imported talent was worth "leaving your own people behind," while acknowledging America's successful strategy of attracting global talent.
Article Summary: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu argues that peak talent migration typically coincides with periods of rapid national development. He pointed to Silicon Valley's shifting demographics, where Indian migrants now outnumber those from China, Hong Kong, and Taiwan.

Article Title: Google Maps error guides cars onto under-construction highway; what happened next....
Article Text:
Image for representation purpose only.

Google Maps is once again in the news for the wrong reasons in India. Two cars crashed in Hathras, Uttar Pradesh after Google Maps allegedly led the drivers onto an under-construction highway. The accident injured six people, with two requiring hospitalization.Vimlesh Srivastava and Keshav Kumar, residents of Bareilly, were traveling to Mathura's Banke Bihari temple on Friday, December 27 night. After reaching the Sikandra Rau area in Hathras around 10 pm, Google Maps reportedly directed them onto the under-construction Mathura-Bareilly highway. Their car crashed into a mound of mud near Hathras Junction. While the airbags deployed, two passengers were injured.The victims also blamed local authorities for the accident, saying the lack of reflective signs and indicators on the unfinished road contributed to the crash.“We were supposed to take the service road but Google Maps directed us onto the highway. The lack of reflective indicators also led to the crash. Local authorities are at fault as well. They should have put up barriers or signages indicating that the road is not ready for use,” Srivastava told Times of India.In a similar incident, a family from Badaun traveling to Mathura ended up on the same under-construction highway because of incorrect directions from Google Maps. Their car crashed into a mud mound after being guided onto a closed road.While the police rescued the passengers, the car was badly damaged. Deputy superintendent of police Shyamveer Singh told TOI, “The two cars were involved in accidents after allegedly being misguided by Google Maps. The road is under development and the contractors have been asked to place barriers and reflective signage”.
Article Summary: Two cars crashed in Hathras, Uttar Pradesh after Google Maps allegedly led the drivers onto an under-construction highway. The accident injured six people, with two requiring hospitalization. The victims blamed local authorities for the accident, saying the lack of reflective signs and indicators on the unfinished road contributed to the crash.

Article Title: 14 days, 37 transactions ...: How Cred lost Rs 12 crore in fraud from two accounts in Axis Bank
Article Text:
How the accused used Cred’s bank accounts to steal from the company

Bengaluru police have arrested four people for allegedly defrauding the parent company of the payment platform Cred of Rs 12 crore. The arrests follow a complaint from a Dreamplug Paytech Solutions Private Limited executive.An Axis Bank relationship manager is among those arrested, accused of involvement in the theft. Dreamplug Paytech Solutions Private Limited is Cred’s parent company. Narasimha Vasanth Sastry, an executive at the company, filed the complaint.The CEN East police are investigating the case. The police told TOI “that the ones arrested include an Axis Bank relationship manager who is also accused of being involved in the theft."Those arrested include Vaibhav Pithadiya, a relationship manager at an Axis Bank branch in Rajkot; Parmar Neha Ben Vipulbhai, a banking agent from Surat; Shailesh, an insurance agent from Rajkot and Pithadiya's colleague; and Shubham, a commission agent also from Rajkot.Last month, Dreamplug executives uncovered the scam after detecting suspicious transactions in the company’s accounts. The online payment aggregator, with offices in Mumbai and Bengaluru, reported that Rs 12.2 crore had been fraudulently withdrawn from two of its Axis Bank accounts—a current account and a nodal account—both opened in 2021.Axis Bank had issued a corporate ID along with four user IDs to Dreamplug, of which the company only activated two. The remaining two IDs were left unused, the company said.However, the investigation revealed that the accused gained unauthorised access to Dreamplug’s bank accounts by manipulating account details with Axis Bank.They reportedly exploited two critical vulnerabilities: first, by submitting fake documents, including forged signatures, seals, and board resolutions; and second, by requesting changes to the registered mobile number and email ID associated with the accounts.Between October and November, a total of 37 fraudulent transactions were carried out. While an attempt was made to transfer Rs 15.2 crore, only Rs 12.2 crore was successfully withdrawn.The first request to change account details was made on July 22 at an Axis Bank branch in Ankleshwar, Gujarat, followed by a second request on October 12 at another branch in Abrama, Surat.Both requests, submitted via suspicious personal email IDs, should have raised concerns as Dreamplug operates out of Bengaluru, the police told TOI.Despite this, Axis Bank processed the changes, enabling the fraudsters to intercept OTPs sent to the updated contact details and authorise transactions to multiple accounts across the country.The fraudulent emails and mobile numbers used in the scheme included vrvithal098@gmail.com, utsavmaterial76@gmail.com, 9662369909, and 8469158856, the police said.The police also cited the company’s executives to inform TOI that the accused used this access to drain the accounts and transfer the funds into various recipient accounts.
Article Summary: Dreamplug Paytech Solutions Private Limited is Cred’s parent company. The arrests follow a complaint from a Dreamplug executive. An Axis Bank relationship manager is among those arrested, accused of involvement in the theft. Between October and November, a total of 37 fraudulent transactions were carried out.

Article Title: Vodafone Idea gets Rs 24,800 Crore relief with bank guarantee waiver, says it will ensure 4G/5G network growth
Article Text:
What Vodafone Idea said on the waiver

Vi, also known as Vodafone Idea , received a waiver of bank guarantee requirements for spectrum auctions conducted in 2012, 2014, 2016, and 2021 from the Department of Telecommunication (DoT) last week. The telecom operator has welcomed the government’s decision to waive the requirement of bank guarantees for past spectrum auctions, stating that it will enable the telecom sector to better utilize banking resources for expanding 4G and 5G networks across India.On December 27, the DoT informed the three private telecom operators — Reliance Jio Bharti Airtel , and Vi — about the waiver of BGs amounting to Rs 33,000 crore. Of this, the lion’s share of relief, totaling Rs 24,800 crore, applies to Vodafone Idea.In an exchange filing, Vi said “This step of BG waiver is a clear indication of the government’s continued support to the telecom industry. It will ensure that the exposure of the banking system is utilized by telecom operators towards further proliferation of 4G and 5G networks in India.”“Prior to this reform, BGs aggregating to Rs 24,800 crore were required to be provided by Vi against each spectrum installment. With this decision, no BGs will be required for auctions held in 2012, 2014, 2016, and 2021,” the company stated.However, Vi noted a one-time partial shortfall for the 2015 auction, where the net present value (NPV) of payments made is less than the pro-rated spectrum usage value. “We are in discussion with the Department of Telecommunications (DoT) to determine the final amount of this partial shortfall for the 2015 auction,” the company added.For Vodafone Idea, which is yet to roll out 5G services, the BG waiver comes as a significant relief. It reduces financial burdens and opens avenues for lenders to extend much-needed credit. This funding will help the struggling telecom operator enhance its 4G coverage and accelerate its 5G rollout to compete with larger rivals Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel.
Article Summary: Vi, also known as Vodafone Idea, received a waiver of bank guarantee requirements for spectrum auctions conducted in 2012, 2014, 2016, and 2021. The DoT informed the three private telecom operators — Reliance Jio Bharti Airtel and Vi — about the waiver of BGs amounting to Rs 33,000 crore. Of this, the lion’s share of relief, totaling Rs 24,800 crore, applies to Vodaphone Idea.

Article Title: Reliance Industries completes Rs 375 crore acquisition of healthtech company Karkinos: All details
Article Text: Reliance Industries, through its subsidiary Reliance Strategic Business Ventures (RSBVL), has acquired the oncology-focused healthcare platform Karkinos for Rs 375 crore. The acquisition was completed with the allotment of shares. Karkinos provides technology-driven solutions for cancer detection, diagnosis, and management. In fiscal year 2022-23, it reported a turnover of approximately Rs 22 crore.The acquisition involved RSBVL subscribing to Rs 10 crore in equity shares and ₹365 crore in optionally fully convertible debentures of Karkinos on December 27, 2024. Existing shares held by previous investors were cancelled as part of the approved resolution plan.Previous investors in Karkinos included Ewart Investments (a Tata Sons subsidiary), Reliance Digital Health (another Reliance Industries subsidiary), Mayo Clinic, Sundar Raman (Director at Reliance Foundation Youth Sports), and Ravi Kant (former MD of Tata Motors).Karkinos aims to provide affordable end-to-end cancer care services while maintaining profitability. It partners with hospitals to offer oncology services and has partnered with approximately 60 hospitals by December 2023. A subsidiary is also establishing a 150-bed multispecialty cancer hospital in Imphal, Manipur. Future revenue streams are expected from Advanced Cancer Care Diagnostics and Research (ACCDR), a Distributed Cancer Care Network (DCCN), corporate partnerships for early diagnosis, and cancer care hospitals.Reliance stated that the acquisition will expand its health services portfolio. The resolution plan, approved by the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT), Mumbai Bench, required no further governmental or regulatory approvals. Reliance had previously announced the NCLT's approval of RSBVL's resolution plan for Karkinos on December 10.
Article Summary: Karkinos provides technology-driven solutions for cancer detection, diagnosis, and management. In fiscal year 2022-23, it reported a turnover of approximately Rs 22 crore. Karkinos aims to provide affordable end-to-end cancer care services while maintaining profitability.

Article Title: Change in UPI Rule: RBI allows UPI access for prepaid payment instruments via third-party apps
Article Text:
What is the UPI rule change

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has significantly expanded the functionality of Prepaid Payment Instruments (PPIs) by allowing users to make and receive UPI payments through any third-party UPI-enabled app. This change, announced by RBI, marks a major step towards interoperability in the digital payments ecosystem.Prepaid Payment Instrument or PPIs is a financial tool that allows users to store funds on a card or digital wallet for future transactions. PPIs store monetary value and can be used for purchasing goods and services, conducting financial services, and facilitating remittances. This new regulation effectively integrates PPIs more deeply into the UPI ecosystem, further solidifying UPI's position as the dominant digital payment platform in India.Previously, UPI transactions involving PPIs, such as digital wallets, gift cards, and metro cards, were confined to the mobile app provided by the specific PPI issuer. This restriction limited user convenience and the broader adoption of PPIs for UPI transactions. Now, holders of full-KYC (Know Your Customer) compliant PPIs can link their instruments to popular UPI apps like Google Pay, PhonePe, Paytm, and BHIM, similar to how they link bank accounts.According to the RBI's circular, "A PPI issuer shall enable holders of only its full-KYC PPIs to make UPI payments by linking its customer PPIs to its UPI handle. UPI transactions from PPI on the issuer’s application shall be authenticated using the customer’s existing PPI credentials. Such a transaction will, thus, be pre-approved before it reaches the UPI system. A PPI issuer, in its capacity as a PSP, shall not on-board customers of any bank or any other PPI issuer." This means that only PPIs with complete customer verification (KYC) will be eligible for this feature. The authentication of these UPI transactions originating from PPIs will occur using the user's existing PPI credentials before the transaction reaches the UPI network, adding an extra layer of security. This pre-authorization process ensures that the PPI issuer validates the transaction before it is processed by the UPI system.The RBI also emphasized that PPI issuers, in their role as payment system providers, are prohibited from onboarding customers of other banks or PPI issuers. This stipulation aims to maintain a clear separation and prevent potential conflicts of interest.This move aligns with the RBI's broader objective of promoting digital payments and enhancing financial inclusion. By enabling greater interoperability between PPIs and the UPI network, the RBI aims to make digital transactions more seamless and accessible for a wider range of users. This decision also brings PPIs on par with bank accounts in terms of UPI accessibility, as bank account holders can already use any UPI app for transactions.UPI, developed by the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), has revolutionized digital payments in India , facilitating instant real-time inter-bank transactions through mobile phones.
Article Summary: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has significantly expanded the functionality of Prepaid Payment Instruments (PPIs) by allowing users to make and receive UPI payments through any third-party UPI-enabled app. This change, announced by RBI, marks a major step towards interoperability in the digital payments ecosystem.

Zoho CEO comments on Narayan Murthy's 70-hour work week

Vijay Sales’ announces Apple Days sale

Meanwhile, the DoT issues a warning against fake scam calls , BSNL rolls out free services, and other tech stories make headlines.Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu discussed the 70-hour work week debate started by Infosys founder Narayana Murthy. Vembu posted on X, formerly known as Twitter, about the need to balance economic growth with sustainable demographics and work-life balance. He recognized East Asian economic progress but also highlighted the impact of intense work cultures. “If you look at East Asia - Japan, South Korea, Taiwan and China have all developed through extreme hard work, often imposing punitive levels of work on their own people” he noted. Vembu’s comments contribute to the ongoing discussion about work hours and societal well-being.The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) is raising awareness about fake calls and fraudulent communications, advising citizens on how to report scams. They suggest filing police complaints, calling 1930, and reporting incidents on the Sanchar Saathi portal. Telecom operators have been instructed to play cybercrime awareness messages 8-10 times daily for three months to educate the public on common scams.Elon Musk has offered $1 billion to Wikipedia to rename itself 'Dickipedia' for a minimum of one year. This proposal was initially made last year and still stands. Musk's offer has sparked significant attention and curiosity about why the Wikimedia Foundation requires substantial funding despite the low operational costs of running Wikipedia.Vijay Sales has announced Apple Days sale from December 29, 2024 across its 140+ retail outlets and online website. The sale will wrap up by 5th January 2025. It promises to offer Apple devices at discounted prices including Apple’s premium lineup, including latest iPhones, MacBooks, iPads, Watches, AirPods, and more. Apple iPhone 16 is available at Rs 66,990, while iPhone 16 Plus can be purchased at Rs 75,490. Old generation iPhones like iPhone 15 and iPhone 14 are selling at Rs 57,490 and Rs 48,990, respectively.Lava has launched the Lava Yuva 2 5G smartphone in India, priced at Rs 9,499. It features a 6.67-inch HD+ display, 50MP main camera, UNISOC T760 chipset, 4GB RAM, and 128GB internal storage expandable up to 512GB. It runs on Android 14 and is powered by a 5000mAh battery.BSNL has introduced three free services in Puducherry, including intranet TV for mobile, national Wi-Fi roaming for BSNL and non-BSNL users, and fibre-based intranet TV services. These offerings aim to improve connectivity and entertainment for customers, expanding Wi-Fi access, and providing live TV channels and on-demand content for mobile and fibre users.
